Newburgh Free Academy was selected to participate in the 2020 cohort of the JROTC-CS Demonstration Project. Out of 2200 schools in the United States, only 30 schools were accepted to be part of this national program.

Three educators from Newburgh Free Academy Main Campus have been selected to attend on behalf of the district, Mrs. Elizabeth Thomas-Cappello, computer science teacher, Master Sergeant Christian Granda, AFJROTC Instructor, and Mr. John Etri, Director of Career and Technical Education. The three educators will attend a capacity building training in late February.

A communication to the district from the Project Director, Tina Boyle Whyte, MHRM, MA, stated: â€œYour participation will help build a national model for increasing access to evidence-based computer science and cybersecurity education at JROTC partner schools across the US.â€

You can find more information on our website!

High school scholars from the Newburgh Free Academy P-TECH program welcomed children and adults tand taught them how to code during the annual national Hour of Code event. The national event started as a one-hour introduction to computer science, designed to demystify "code," to show that anybody can learn the basics, and to broaden participation in the field of computer science. NFA P-TECH scholars offered two one-hour sections and taught computer technology skills to students from our community.

Activities included coding video games and programming robots to launch objects.

8th grade scholars can learn more about the NFA P-TECH program tonight at 7pm at the High School Selection Tour for NFA P-TECH at NFA North Campus.

More photos from the event: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ZGmnKbtFL1Ui3dVZjG4kZ1t4FlN-Eira?usp=sharing

The Newburgh Enlarged City School District welcomed nearly 70 people from various community organizations for a call to action to help support the My Brother's Keeper program.

The relaunch event celebrated a rejuvenation of the MBK program throughout NECSD. For the last two years, approximately four schools participated in the program. Newburgh Free Academy Hosts Annual Pep Rally!

Students cheered for their class years to compete over who has the most school spirit last week. Fall teams were announced, teams performed, and school and class year pride was on full display. Students competed by class level in various activities to earn points toward the traditional prize of bragging rights!

Performances were given by: Madrigals, NFA Band with Advanced Dance Company, NFA Drumline, ROTC Color Guard and Drill Team, NFA Varsity Cheerleaders, Advanced Dance Team, Dance Department, Hip Hop/ Step Team.

Fall teams announced were: Boys & Girls Cross Country, Girls Varsity Tennis, Girls Soccer, Girls Swimming & Diving, Cheerleading, and Football.

Games included: Office Depot Relay, Class vs Class Dodgeball, and Hungry Hungry Hippo.

The evening was coordinated by the NFA Student Council.

All photos from the NFA Pep Rally can be viewed and downloaded for free here: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1AvFfhuVUCrWfEacA57Rspn0A6-DD9lbK
